item.title: US and China trade angry words at high-level Alaska talks
item.description: The first high-level meeting of the new US administration and Beijing opened with sharp rebukes.

item.title: Covid: Paris lockdown as France fears third wave
item.description: The French capital and various other areas will have movement restricted as cases rise.

item.title: Nigeria school abductions: Why are schoolchildren being kidnapped?
item.description: Parts of Nigeria are seeing unprecedented mass school abductions that have left at least one student dead.

item.title: Young Goldman Sachs bankers ask for 80-hour week cap
item.description: First-year analysts have reported 95-hour working weeks plus poor physical and mental health.

item.title: China sending children of exiled Uighur parents to orphanages, says Amnesty
item.description: Young Uighur children are taken into orphanages without parents' consent, Amnesty International says.

item.title: Samia Suluhu Hassan - Tanzania's new president
item.description: Vice-President Samia Suluhu Hassan steps up after the death of President John Magufuli.

item.title: Myanmar protests: BBC journalist Aung Thura detained
item.description: Aung Thura was taken away by plainclothes men, as eight more people reported killed by security forces.

item.title: SLS: Successful test for world's most powerful rocket
item.description: Engineers have carried out a major engine test of Nasa's Space Launch System.

item.title: E-bike suspected cause of huge Australia house fire
item.description: The bike was left on charge overnight at the three-level house in Sydney, firefighters says.

item.title: Armie Hammer: US actor accused of rape
item.description: The Call Me By Your Name star denies the allegations, saying the relationship was consensual.

item.title: Peloton: Child killed in 'tragic' treadmill accident
item.description: Boss of the home fitness equipment firm warns parents to keep children away from its machines.

item.title: Chinese granny who fought off attacker in US praised for bravery
item.description: The 76-year-old was waiting to cross the street in San Francisco when she was punched, reports say.

item.title: Oscars 2021: Nominees told Zoom attendance not an option
item.description: Producers say great efforts have been made to make the show safe to attend in person.

item.title: Anti-Asian violence: 'He slashed me from cheek-to-cheek'
item.description: Asian Americans across the US have faced a surge in hate crimes during the pandemic.

item.title: Who this Japanese biker actually turned out to be
item.description: The 50-year-old biker said he thought his social media followers would not want to see an old "uncle".

item.title: At least 25 tornadoes rip through southern US
item.description: Powerful storms have swept through the region, wrecking havoc in parts of Mississippi and Alabama.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 12-18 March 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent.

item.title: Death of a Zulu king: 'He is planted, not buried'
item.description: Photos of Goodwill Zwelithini's funeral - an insight into how a powerful South African monarch is mourned.

item.title: US Border: Risking everything for an American dream
item.description: Thousands of migrants from Central America are making an arduous journey to the US border.

item.title: Super Nintendo World opens in Japan after Covid delays
item.description: The theme park features iconic characters like Mario as well as rides based on games.

item.title: Drag Race UK: 'I refuse to be a doormat for hate'
item.description: Bimini, Tayce, Lawrence and Ellie discuss the ways that being on the show has changed their lives.

item.title: 'Stingy men' take on Nigeria's dating etiquette
item.description: Frustrations about the cost of dating have raised serious questions about romantic relationships.

item.title: Why are women still doing most of the childcare?
item.description: After a year of pandemic and lockdowns, mothers are still doing most of the childcare, a report shows.

item.title: Atlanta spa shootings: Who are the victims?
item.description: Six of the eight people killed were Asian women. Here's what we know so far about the victims.

item.title: The 'insane' money in trading collectible cards
item.description: Prices of collectible cards are soaring and new digital products are entering the market.

item.title: Nevada smart city: A millionaire’s plan to create a local government
item.description: Jeffrey Berns wants to build a tech oasis in the Nevada desert. Do others share his utopian vision?

item.title: India coronavirus: Can its vaccine producers meet demand?
item.description: India is a big player in vaccine production - but companies are warning of supply problems.

item.title: The cautionary tale of the president who denied Covid
item.description: His death will reenergise debate about whether the continent needs strong institutions or strongmen.

item.title: Covid: From boom to bust - why lockdown hasn't led to more babies
item.description: Research shows that the US and parts of Europe are facing slumps in birth rates.

item.title: Asia's richest man, a bomb scare and a murder in India
item.description: An explosives-laden car is found near Mukesh Ambani's home in Mumbai, and its alleged owner is killed.

item.title: Liverpool face Real Madrid in Champions League - full quarter and semi-final draws
item.description: Liverpool will face Real Madrid in the quarter-finals of the Champions League, while Manchester City will play Borussia Dortmund and Chelsea will face Porto.

item.title: Man Utd face Granada, Arsenal play Slavia Prague in Europa League
item.description: Manchester United will play Granada in the Europa League quarter-finals, while Arsenal will face Slavia Prague.

item.title: Mourinho says Spurs failed 'at the basics of life' as Lloris calls Europa League exit 'a disgrace'
item.description: Jose Mourinho apologises to Tottenham fans and says his players failed "at the basics of life" as they are knocked out of the Europa League.

item.title: 'Paul makes a very, very big difference for us' - Pogba edges Man Utd past Milan
item.description: Paul Pogba scores the winner on his Manchester United return as they edge past AC Milan to reach the Europa League quarter-finals.

item.title: Rangers won't let Kamara 'be yet another statistic' as they demand Uefa racism response
item.description: Rangers want "a robust and unequivocal response" from Uefa over alleged racial abuse of Glen Kamara by Sparta Prague's Ondrej Kudel.

item.title: UFC champion Nurmagomedov '100% officially retired'
item.description: Lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov has "100% officially retired", from UFC says the organisation's president Dana White.

item.title: Covid: The inside story of the government's battle against the virus
item.description: Twenty of Downing Street's most senior politicians, officials and former officials take you "into the room" where essential Covid decisions were being made.
